revised_title: The Role of D-Xyloketose in the Germination of Striga hermonthica
tldr: Researchers discovered that the seeds of the parasitic plant Striga hermonthica only germinate when exposed to a chemical stimulant released from a host plant root. They found that the stimulant, d-xyloketose, promotes germination at lower concentrations than other substances. This study helps to understand the complex relationship between parasitic plants and their hosts.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
